I am a second-year Ph.D. student in Computer Sciences at University of Wisconsin–Madison and a member of MadPL group. I work on verifying probabilistic programs. I hope one day we can guarantee critical algorithms are correct, socially beneficial, and making sense, with high degree of confidence, before putting them in use. I am very fortunate to be advised by Justin Hsu to explore my interests.

Before coming to UW–Madison, I did my undergrad in Mathematics and Computer Science at Cornell, where I was fortunate to start my research journey with mentoring from Nate Foster, John E. Hopcroft, and Michael Macy.

Email: {first name}@cs.wisc.edu

News

  • 2021.07 I will move back to Cornell with my advisor.

  • 2021.02 Talked about work on a data-driven method to generate Weakest Pre-expectation on PPS-PIHOC-DIAPASoN Workshop!

  • 2020.10 Presented at MadPL’s PL seminar :D

  • 2019.12 Poster on a logic for conditional independence accepted to Student Research Competition at POPL!

  • 2019.08 Started Ph.D. study at UW–Madison!

Drafts
